intro: Pilosella eginensis, commonly known as the Echinus-leaved Potentilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disk florets surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Pilosella eginensis typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its hairy, spoon-shaped leaves give it a distinctive appearance, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
